com.camerontec.util.concurrent.circularbuffer

Interface CircularBuffer<E>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - The element type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    CircularBufferMXBean
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SingleConsumerCircularBuffer

    public interface CircularBuffer<E>
extends CircularBufferMXBean
    Interface to be implemented by concurrent circular buffer implementations.

    Circular buffer producers put elements into the buffer in 3 steps:

    1. Acquire the next free entry (waiting for consumers to catch up if required) - see getNextProducerEntry()
    2. Move data into the free entry (either by assigning a new reference or copying)
    3. Commit the free entry
    Circular buffer consumers read elements from the buffer in batches via the consumeBatch(CircularBufferConsumer) method. Each consumer must implement CircularBufferConsumer in order to consume entries as they become available.

    Producer/consumer thread coordination policies and associated performance trade-offs are implementation dependent and no guarantees are given here. Note, however, that this interface is not yet generic enough to handle the multiple consumer case and would required modification in order to be able to support that.

      int capacity() 
      void commit(CircularBuffer.Entry<E> entry)
      Commit an entry after producing data to it, blocking if necessary to await correct producer sequencing in the case of multiple producers.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.camerontec.util.concurrent.circularbuffer.CircularBufferMXBean

        clear, getcapacity, geteventsConsumedCount, geteventsProducedCount, getutilizationPercentage

    • Method Detail

      • shutdownProducers

        void shutdownProducers()
        Shutdown the producing side of the buffer.

        This method is used to permanently shutdown the buffer for production. Any producer threads that are currently blocked are awoken forced to handle java.lang.InterruptedException. If producing threads continue to attempt to produce following this the behaviour is undefined.

      • shutdownConsumers

        void shutdownConsumers()
        Shutdown the consuming side of the buffer.

        This method is used to permanently shutdown the buffer for consumption. Any consumer threads that are currently blocked are awoken forced to handle java.lang.InterruptedException. If consuming threads continue to attempt to consume following this the behaviour is undefined.

      • capacity

        int capacity()
        Returns:
        The circular buffer's capacity.

      • remaining

        int remaining()
        Returns:
        The remaining capacity in the buffer.

      • getNextProducerEntry

        CircularBuffer.Entry<E> getNextProducerEntry()
                                      throws InterruptedException
        Return the next free entry for a producer, blocking if necessary to await an entry to become available.
        Returns:
        The next free entry for a producer.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - On being interrupted while awaiting a free entry.

      • tryGetNextProducerEntry

        CircularBuffer.Entry<E> tryGetNextProducerEntry()
        Return the next free entry for a producer, returning immediately if no entries are available.
        Returns:
        The next free entry for a producer, or null if an entry is not immediately available.

      • commit

        void commit(CircularBuffer.Entry<E> entry)
     throws InterruptedException
        Commit an entry after producing data to it, blocking if necessary to await correct producer sequencing in the case of multiple producers.
        Parameters:
        entry - The produced entry.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - On being interrupted while committing an entry.

      • consumeBatch

        int consumeBatch(CircularBufferConsumer<E> consumer)
          throws InterruptedException
        Consume the next batch of available entries, blocking indefinitely or until interrupted, if necessary for entries to become available for consumption.
        Parameters:
        consumer - The consumer to which available entries are dispatched.
        Returns:
        The number of entries consumed in the batch.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - On being interrupted while awaiting an entry for consumption.

      • consumeBatch

        int consumeBatch(CircularBufferConsumer<E> consumer,
                 long timeout,
                 TimeUnit timeunit)
          throws InterruptedException
        Consume the next batch of available entries, blocking if necessary for entries to become available for consumption.
        Parameters:
        consumer - The consumer to which available entries are dispatched.
        timeout - The blocking timeout for entries to become available for consumption.
        timeunit - The blocking timeout units.
        Returns:
        The number of entries consumed in the batch.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - On being interrupted while awaiting an entry for consumption.

      • tryConsumeBatch

        int tryConsumeBatch(CircularBufferConsumer<E> consumer)
        Consume the next batch of available entries, returning immediately if no entries are available.
        Parameters:
        consumer - The consumer to which available entries are dispatched.
        Returns:
        The number of entries consumed in the batch.
